author: tsophra
title: Mixing Business with Pleasure
text:
I was in the area for a business meeting w/ 2 personal days and this hotel was the perfect counterpoint to all day meetings. I cannot say enough positive things about this lovely hotel. Upon arrival, I upgraded to The Level and it was totally worth it. The lounge is relaxing with a wide variety of tapas and alcoholic beverages. The Ros√© cava was excellent.. Room was beautiful with a lovely view of the city. Although I was measured in my eating, breakfast was loaded with tempting choice. The housekeeping, breakfast, lounge and front desk team all professional, pleasant and helpful. Special nod to Julio (Iglesias ) and the lovely young lady from Mexico at the check in desk in the Lounge..so nice. Only slight downside was the Skyline Lounge. On a Saturday night I went for a drink and the view..the crowd was overwhelmingly young and it was a full blown club. Everyone seemed to be having a lovely time ..but not my scene ....so no drink...no view.
Usually, I'm quite unimpressed with the Spanish chains (Caribbean) but I'm now a Melia fan girl. Will look for them later this year when I visit Spain.
